He turned his pen against all the internal and domestic enemies of the Church, by attacking the monstrous errors which were adopted by many of the primitive Chris- tians, as appears by his five books against heresies, which are considered as one of the most precious monuments of ancient erudition ; yet, though se- veral editions of them have been given in Greek and Latin, no translation has appeared in our own language. Irenaeus suffered death in the fifth per- secution of the Christians under Septimus Severus, A.D. 202.
